text.*:
The examples and perspective in this article may not represent a worldwide view of the subject. You may improve this article, discuss the issue on the talk page, or create a new article, as appropriate. (December 2010) (Learn how and when to remove this template message)

This is a list of worldwide authors' conferences for writers of all genres.

This is a dynamic list and may never be able to satisfy particular standards for completeness. You can help by expanding it with reliably sourced entries.

Contents

  • 1 Europe
    • 1.1 Bulgaria
    • 1.2 France
    • 1.3 Iceland
    • 1.4 Ireland
    • 1.5 Portugal
    • 1.6 United Kingdom
  • 2 North America
    • 2.1 Bahamas
    • 2.2 Canada
    • 2.3 United States
      • 2.3.1 A–E
      • 2.3.2 F–M
      • 2.3.3 N–Z
  • 3 South America
    • 3.1 Peru
  • 4 See also
  • 5 Notes

Europe[edit]

Bulgaria[edit]

  • Sozopol Fiction Seminars – Sozopol[1]

France[edit]

  • Paris Writers Retreat – Paris[2]

Iceland[edit]

  • Iceland Writers Retreat – Reykjavík[3]

Ireland[edit]

  • BooksGoSocial Dublin Writers Conference – Fiction & Non Fiction – Dublin[4]

Portugal[edit]

  • Disquiet International Literary Program – Lisbon[5]

United Kingdom[edit]

  • Festival of Writing – York[6]
  • Historical Novel Society Conference – September, London[7]
  • Milford Writer's Workshop – science fiction writers; various locations[8]
  • Winchester Writers' Conference – Winchester[9]
  • Swanwick Writers' Summer School[10] – the UK's longest-running writers' school
  • Writers Holiday[11]

North America[edit]

Bahamas[edit]

  • Salt Cay Writers Retreat – Salt Cay, Bahamas[12]

Canada[edit]

  • Shuswap International Writers' Festival – Salmon Arm, British Columbia
  • Surrey International Writers' Conference – Surrey, British Columbia
  • Ontario Writers' Conference – Durham Region, Ontario[13]

United States[edit]

A–E[edit]

  • The Alabama Writers' Conclave – Alabama[14]
  • Alabama Writing Workshop – Birmingham, Alabama[15]
  • Algonkian Writer Conferences – Arizona, California, Massachusetts, Virginia[16]
  • The Aloha Writers Conference – Kapalua, Maui, Hawaii[17]
  • American Christian Fiction Writers Conference – location varies[18]
  • American Society of Journalists and Authors (ASJA) annual conference – New York City, New York[19]
  • Antioch Writers' Workshop – Yellow Springs, Ohio[20]
  • Art of the Wild Writers' Conference – Olympic Valley, California
  • Association of Personal Historians conference – location varies, Canada and United States
  • Atlanta Writers Conference – Atlanta, Georgia[21]
  • Atlanta Writing Workshop – Atlanta, Georgia[22]
  • Atlantic Center for the Arts Master Artists-in-Residence Program – New Smyrna Beach, Florida[23]
  • The Auburn Writers Conference – Auburn, Alabama[24]
  • Author U Extravaganza conference – Denver, Colorado[25]
  • Authors Combat Academy – Nashville, Tennessee[26]
  • Authors Conference Infinity Publishing Gathering of Authors – Valley Forge, Pennsylvania[27]
  • Authors of the Flathead conference – Kalispell, Montana[28]*
  • Authors' Salon at Clockwork Alchemy - Burlingame, California[29]*
  • Avondale Writers Conference – Avondale, Arizona[30]
  • AWP Conference & Bookfair – North America's largest literary conference; location varies[31]
  • Backspace Writers Conference[32]
  • Bear River Writers' Conference – Boyne City, Michigan[33]
  • Blaze Your Own Trail to Self-Publishing Writers' Conference – San Diego, California[34]
  • BlogU – Baltimore, Maryland[35]
  • Blue Flower Arts Winter Writers Conference – New Smyrna Beach, Florida[36]
  • Book Passage Children's Writers & Illustrators Conference – Corte Madera, California[37]
  • Book Passage Mystery Writers Conference – Corte Madera, California[38]
  • Book Passage Travel Writers & Photographers Conference – Corte Madera, California[39]
  • BookBaby Independent Authors Conference – Philadelphia, PA[40]
  • Boston Writing Workshop – Boston, Massachusetts[41]
  • Bread Loaf Writers' Conference – Middlebury, Vermont
  • Business of Pet Writing Conference – New York City, New York[42]
  • Business of Writing International Summit – August 1–2, 2014; Louisville, Kentucky[43]
  • California Dreamin' Writers' Conference – Brea, California[44]
  • Calliope Writing Coach – year round; Salt Lake City, Utah[45]
  • Cape Cod Writers Center Conference – Cape Cod, Massachusetts[46]
  • Carolinas Writers Conference – Wadesboro, North Carolina
  • Castle Rock Writers' Conference – Castle Rock, Colorado[47]
  • Chanticleer Authors Conference – Bellingham, Washington[48]
  • Chapter One Young Writers Conference – Chicago, Illinois[49]
  • Chesapeake Writing Workshop – Washington, D.C.[50]
  • Chicago Writing Workshop – Chicago, Illinois[51]
  • Chuckanut Writers Conference – Bellingham, Washington[52]
  • Cleveland Writing Workshop – Cleveland, Ohio[53]
  • Colorado Christian Writers Conference – Estes Park, Colorado
  • Colorado Gold – Denver, Colorado[54]
  • Colrain Poetry Manuscript Conference – Colrain, Massachusetts
  • The Creative Nonfiction Writers Conference – Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania[55]
  • Crested Butte Writers Conference – Crested Butte, Colorado[56]
  • Crossroads Writers' Conference – Macon, Georgia[57]
  • DFW Writers Conference (DFWCon) – Dallas-Fort Worth, Texas[58]
  • Erma Bombeck Writers' Workshop – Dayton, Ohio

F–M[edit]

  • Florida Writing Workshop – Tampa, Florida[59]
  • Florida Christian Writers Conference Leesburg, Florida[60]
  • The Frost Place Conference on Poetry – Franconia, New Hampshire[61]
  • The Frost Place Conference on Poetry and Teaching – Franconia, New Hampshire[62]
  • The Frost Place Poetry Seminar – Franconia, New Hampshire[63]
  • The Frost Place Writing Intensive – Franconia, New Hampshire[64]
  • Georgia Writers SpringFest Conference – Kennesaw, Georgia
  • Golden Crown Literary Society Annual Conference – 2014, Portland, Oregon; 2015, New Orleans, Louisiana; 2015, Alexandria, Virginia and Washington, D.C.
  • Hampton Roads Writers' Conference – Virginia Beach, Virginia[65]
  • Hawaii Writers Conference (formerly the Maui Writers Conference) – Maui, Hawaii[66]
  • HippoCamp: A Conference for Creative Nonfiction Writers, presented by Hippocampus Magazine – August 2015, Lancaster, Pennsylvania[67]
  • Historical Novel Society Conference in North America – mid-to-late June; various locations[68]
  • Historical Writers of America Conference – August 19–21, 2016, Colonial Williamsburg, Virginia[69]
  • Hollihock Writers Conference – New Bedford, Massachusetts[70]
  • Horseback Writing Retreats[71] – Wyoming[72]
  • Houston Writers Guild – Annual Writers Conference – April; various locations[73]
  • How to Write & Publish Your Book – Mississippi[74]
  • Indiana Faith and Writing Conference – Anderson, Indiana[75]
  • Indiana University Writers' Conference – Bloomington, Indiana[76]
  • Indiana Writing Workshop – Indianapolis, Indiana[77]
  • Jack London Writers Conference – San Francisco, California
  • Jackson Hole Writers Conference – Jackson Hole, Wyoming
  • Judith Briles Unplugged Authors and Writers Conference – August 27–29, 2015; Denver, Colorado[78]
  • Juniper Institute for Young Writers – Amherst, Massachusetts[79]
  • Juniper Summer Writing Institute – Amherst, Massachusetts[80]
  • Kachemak Bay Writers Conferenece – Homer, Alaska[81]
  • Kauai Writers Conference – November 9 - 11, 2018; Kapaa, Kauai, Hawaii[82]
  • KentuckyWomen Writers Conference – Lexington, Kentucky[83]
  • Key West Literary Seminar – Key West, Florida
  • Killer Nashville – last full weekend every August; Nashville, Tennessee[84]
  • LA Writers Conference – Los Angeles, California[85]
  • Liberty States Fiction Writers Create Something Magical Conference – Iselin, New Jersey[86]
  • Life the Universe & Everything (LTUE) – Provo, Utah[87]
  • Los Angeles Writers Retreat – Los Angeles, California[88]
  • Mad Anthony Writers' Conference – Hamilton, Ohio[89]
  • Mendocino Coast Writers Conference – Fort Bragg, California[90]
  • Michigan Writing Workshop – Livonia, Michigan[91]
  • Minnesota Writing Workshop – Minneapolis, Minnesota[92]
  • Mississippi Writers Guild Writers' Conference – Vicksburg, Mississippi[93]

N–Z[edit]

  • Nashville Writers Conference – Nashville, Tennessee[94]
  • NETWO's Annual Spring Writers Roundup – Mt. Pleasant, Texas[95]
  • New Orleans Genre Writer's Conference – New Orleans, Louisiana[96]
  • North Georgia Christian Writers Conference – Toccoa, Georgia[97]
  • Northern Colorado Writers Conference – Fort Collins, Colorado[98]
  • New York Pitch Conference – New York City, New York[99]
  • Philadelphia Writing Workshop – Philadelphia, Pennsylvania[100]
  • Pikes Peak Writers Conference – Colorado Springs, Colorado
  • Pittsburgh Writing Workshop – Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania[101]
  • PublishingGame.com Conference – Boston, Massachusetts[102]
  • River Writing Journeys for Women[103] – Moab, Utah[104]
  • Rosemary Beach Spring Writers' Conference – May 11–14, 2011; Rosemary Beach, Florida[105]
  • St. Davids Christian Writers' Conference – Grove City, Pennsylvania[106]
  • San Francisco Writers Conference – February 14–17; San Francisco, California[107]
  • San Francisco Writing Workshop – San Francisco, California[108]
  • Sanibel Island Writers Conference – Sanibel Island, Florida[109]
  • Santa Barbara Writers Conference – Santa Barbara, California[110]
  • Santa Fe Writers Conference – Santa Fe, New Mexico
  • Scribbler's Retreat Writer's Conference – St. Simons Island, Georgia
  • Seattle Writing Workshop – Seattle, Washington[111]
  • Sewanee Writers' Conference – Sewanee, Tennessee
  • SF:SE 2015 – Orlando, Florida[112]
  • Society of Children's Book Writers and Illustrators – two per year: summer – Los Angeles, California; winter – New York City, New York[113]
  • Southampton Writers Conference – Southampton, New York
  • Southern California Writers' Conference
  • Southern Christian Writers Conference – Tuscaloosa, Alabama[114]
  • Southern Women Writer's Conference – Berry College, Rome, Georgia
  • Southwest Christian Writers Conference – Durango, Colorado[115]
  • Space Coast Writers' Guild Annual Conference – Melbourne, Florida
  • Squaw Valley Writer's Conference – Olympic Valley, California
  • Taos Summer Writers' Conference – Taos, New Mexico[116]
  • Tennessee Writing Workshop – Nashville, Tennessee[117]
  • Truckee Meadows Community College (TMCC) Writers' Conference – Reno, Nevada[118]
  • UNF Writers Conference – August 5–7, 2011; University of North Florida, Jacksonville, Florida[119]
  • Unicorn Writer's Conference – Manhattanville College, Purchase, New York[120]
  • Wesleyan Writers Conference – Middletown, Connecticut[121]
  • West Coast Writers Conference – July 20–22, 2012; Los Angeles Valley College, Los Angeles, California[122]
  • Willamette Writers conference – Willamette Writers' annual conference; on the first weekend in August; Portland, Oregon[123]
  • Women Writers Conference – September 12–13, 2014; Lexington, Kentucky[124]
  • Women Writing the West – Los Angeles, California[125]
  • WordSmitten Writing Conference – St. Petersburg, Florida[126]
  • Write-by-the-Lake Annual Writer's Retreat – Madison, Wisconsin[127]
  • Write in Atlanta 2011 – Atlanta, Georgia[128]
  • Write Stuff – Greater Lehigh Valley Writers Group, Bethlehem, Pennsylvania[129]
  • Write to Publish Conference – Wheaton, Illinois[130]
  • Writer's Digest Conference – August 1–3, 2014; The Roosevelt Hotel, New York City, New York[131]
  • The Writer's Hotel NYC Writers Conference – New York City, New York[132]
  • The Writers' Institute – Madison, Wisconsin[133]
  • Writers' Police Academy – Green Bay, Wisconsin [134]
  • Writers @ Work – Park City, Utah[135]
  • Writers in Florence[136]
  • Writers in New York[137]
  • Writers in Paradise – St. Petersburg, Florida[138]
  • Writers in Paris[139]
  • The Writing Academy – Farmington, Minnesota[140]
  • Writing and Illustrating for Young Readers Conference – Salt Lake City, Utah[141]
  • Writing By Writers Workshop @ Tomales Bay[142]
  • Writing It Real in Port Townsend – Port Townsend, Washington[143]
  • Yale Writers' Conference – New Haven, Connecticut[144]

South America[edit]

Peru[edit]

  • Peru, Weaving Words & Women[145]

  • Lists portal
  • Writing portal
